intro: Bladhia squamulosa, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, silver-gray foliage. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Bladhia squamulosa has a compact growth habit and produces vibrant pink to purple flowers during the spring and summer months. It is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
